page.title: 15A PERSONAL VIEW OF RYTON
page.content: {The Blacksmith's Arms}is the oldest pub in the village,the{Landlord, Derek {Warrington}said: "As a newcomer..... I find the locals friendly and in the main older.The customers provide their own entertainment,such as darts. I notice that the younger people tend to drink together in one part of the pub, away from the older.It seems a shame that the old and young find it hard to mix.I'm sure the youngsters could learn a lot by talking to some of the wise old characters. I have also noticed a marked presence of{"family" in the village.{It seems that many are {born, live and die in the village.}I have learnt to be diplomatic, as it is important you say the right thing in a {small closed environment}such as we have.The{unemployed}do not come in and so miss out on an important source of friendship and support."
